discourse_list.title: Potential rename of MetaDAOs to Maker SubDAOs

content.content: Together with some contributors from the Growth CU and others, I have started a process of trying to simplify and improve the language related to the Endgame plan to make it easier to explain and market over the next year leading up to the Endgame Plan Launch in Q4 2023. The biggest suggested change that has come up is renaming MetaDAOs to Maker SubDAOs. The main reason is to avoid having to explain what a SubDAO is, since the term is more well known and more self-explanatory. Technically, a MetaDAO simply means a Maker SubDAO so the two are synonymous. The main downside is that SubDAO is not a very appealing brand, and is more of a technical term, however I think this can be solved by emphasizing the class names of the SubDAOs instead: Creator SubDAOs, Protector SubDAOs and Governor SubDAOs Other suggestions have been calling them “MiniDAOs”. It would be best to get clarity on this naming as soon as possible, and the deadline where a final decision will be required is when we vote in the language of the first Scope Frameworks and the Endgame Constitution at the end of Q1. The Recognized Launch MetaDAO Cluster MIP will also need edits, as well as any other MIPs that already exist that reference MetaDAOs. This will not be the only term to be changed, and in general the goal is to streamline terms away from “Endgame terms” towards more easily accessible words. All ideas for simplifications and better or catchier terms are welcome
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is proposing a potential rename of MetaDAOs to Maker SubDAOs to simplify and improve the language related to the Endgame plan. The post explains the reasoning behind the proposed change and suggests alternative names. The author is seeking feedback and ideas for simplifications and better terms. The post also mentions the need for edits in existing MIPs that reference MetaDAOs and a deadline for a final decision.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal
None

content.content: We think this is a good initiative - as someone who dedicates time to understanding the vision of different DAOs - the Endgame Plan boasts some of the greatest complexity. It is important to streamline the language to make it easier for folks to understand. This helps with word-of-mouth marketing, education, and encourages token-holders to better understand the architecture and goals of the plan. Excited to see more simplicity bleed into the forum.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal
3rd party extending to proposal

content.content: I want to declare my strong support for renaming. SubDAOs are a big improvement over MetaDAOs, in my opinion. Please continue this initiative to move toward colloquial language!
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal

content.content: Although personally the term “metaDAOs” sounds more impressive and cool, I have no doubt that this new term will help the masses to understand a little better. Also let’s remember the popular thinking, if they read the word Meta, people automatically associate it with the company or with the metaverse.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: I also agree that SubDAOs is more immediately accessible to lay observers, but one downside could be that the change in framing fails to capture the independence of MetaDAOS. Part of the appeal of MetaDAOs is that they are arms length from Maker: Maker Core isn’t beholden to any particular MetaDAO. The terminology ‘SubDAO’ might hint at a system of CU-like structures, rather than the more autonomous structure envisaged by the Endgame Plan. Just a thought! In general, big fan of reducing some of the complexity around the Endgame and glad to see more distillable and explainable language on the way.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party extending to proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: At the DAOist in Bogota — the term SubDAOs was already being defined as the description for a subDAO of a DAO by participants. Hence, this term will become quite crowded real fast—and MakerSubDAOs will need to distinguish themselves in a crowd. Preference here for MetaDAOs but hey to each its own when it comes to marketing.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party extending to proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: That’s great - I always felt that MetaDAO is the wrong term for those entities. MakerDAO is the true meta one  I think SubDAO or MakerSubDAO is fine - feels a bit clumsy, but it does capture the relationship with MakerDAO better than the previous term
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party extending to proposal

content.content: Perhaps we may consider something to differentiate from prior terms eg. Maker NetworkDAOs (NDAOs) or SystemDAOs (SDAOs) come off the top of mind.

Growth is working on the endgame plan narrative to make it more comprehensible for everyone. We started by redefining the chapters of the plan and the terminology by identifying the main terms and assessing their connotations. We started working on this a week ago, once we have something ready, we will share it with all. I like this community brainstorming about the terms  we will keep an eye on your suggestions.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: My two cents: ‘Maker SubDAOs’ are definitely easier to grasp without contextual knowledge about Endgame, and it bears the superpower of the MakerDAO brand. This renaming could make the concept of MetaDAOs less abstract and more closely associated with Maker. Refer to this essay on Bankless which tries to break down the concept of a subDAO—in my opinion it aligns well with the idea of MetaDAOs in the Endgame context (eg. economic alignment with Maker Core, autonomy)
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party extending to proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Are they arms-length and autonomous, though? They are like subsidiaries, in my opinion. So the term SubDAO seems to cover that quite nicely.

One could also use something a la degrees in degrees of separation - i.e. MakerDAO is a DAO0 and MetaDAO’s a DAO1 - and if the MetaDAO get DAO’s under control they are DAO2’s etc etc. I.e. MetaDAO = DAO1 … but perhaps not great marketing I see that.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party extending to proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: What about DAU, with U for Unit? Then we have the Maker DAO and the Maker DAUs.

Allan_Pedersen:  One could also use something a la degrees in degrees of separation - i.e. MakerDAO is a DAO0 and MetaDAO’s a DAO1 - and if the MetaDAO get DAO’s under control they are DAO2’s etc etc. I.e. MetaDAO = DAO1 … but perhaps not great marketing I see that.   Or just building on this, Maker Layer 1 (Maker Core) and Maker Layer 2 (MetaDAOs)? So referring to MetaDAOs as Maker L2s. Rune has made a similar comparison before.
